div.head: To the Courteous and gentle Reader.
div.p: GEntle Reader, reade no further then you like, if you finde any thing to your Content: thinke well of mee for my paines. If there be nothing that likes you, my lucke is nought: in nothing there can be no great thing, yet something may bee founde, though nothing to any great purpose. Well, there are diuers Nothings, which you shall reade further off, if you will take paines to turne ouer the leafe, and peruse the rest that followes. Now, though I will wish you looke for no meruailous, or worthy thing, yet shall you finde something, though in effect (as it were) nothing, yet in conceit a pretie thing to passe away the time withal. Wel, if you stande content with this Nothing, it may bee ere long, I will send you something, more to your liking: till when, I wish you nothing but well. And so I bid you fare well, from my Chamber at the blacke Friers.
